results.title: Golden summers: the Heidelberg school
results.creator_credit: Peter Purvis, Peter Bramley and National Gallery of Victoria
results.brief_description: Golden Summers covers the most celebrated period in the history of Australian art, the years from 1885 until shortly after the turn of the century. The artists at the time were Tom Roberts, Arthur Streeton, Charles Conder and Fred McCubbin, popularly known as the Heidelberg School, and they believed that it was their task to paint Australian realities. Narrated by Patrick McCaughey.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Purvis, Peter Bramley and National Gallery of Victoria

results.title: Every Inch Australian
results.creator_credit: Roland Litchfield, Litchfield Films and ACTIL
results.brief_description: Gives a complete picture of processes used in the manufacture of cotton sheeting at the Actil plant at Woodville, South Australia. Emphasis is placed on the scientific control and checking of all production processes from the arrival of bales of raw cotton to the final packing of Actil products and their despatch to all parts of Australia.

results.title: Going Our Way
results.creator_credit: Chris Gallagher, Victorian Railways and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: Presents the many employment opportunities in the Victorian Railways. A young boy playing with his toys, including a train, dreams of his future. He becomes a station assistant. Shows how he learns his job and benefits from the V.R.I. library and sporting clubs. Includes executive officers who started at the bottom and worked their way to the top.

results.title: Living Hawthorn
results.creator_credit: Millard Johnson, William Alfred Gibson and Johnson and Gibson
results.brief_description: Shows a variety of street scenes in Hawthorn, Victoria, in the early 20th century including shots of Burwood Road, Glenferrie Station, local shops and businesses, traders and residents. Of historical and heritage value. Cinematography by Millard Johnson.

results.title: Marvellous Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Charles Cozens Spencer and Spencer Productions
results.brief_description: In this silent film approximately 15 static and moving shots, including those from a cable car, are separated by intertitles. They take on a Lumiere look with the way that they picture Melbourne’s main streets and buildings that were prominent at the time. The different fashion and the horse and cart transportation are even more fascinating in this familiar setting.

results.title: [Darcy Prendergast's Light Pen Animation]
results.brief_description: Animator Darcy Prendergast was commissioned by ACMI to make some light-hearted works – representing film, TV and games – for display on screens throughout the ACMI building. Using his lightpen technique and combining computer animated movement with real-life locations, the films are a ‘hat-tip’ to the internationally popular feature films and characters of the Australian film industry.
